pageContext.claim: “Highly Respected Ken Starr: 'Pennsylvania’s three-day extension of the mail-in ballot deadline is a Constitutional Travesty.' Legal scholars agree!”
pageContext.analysis: There is nothing illegal about counting absentee ballots that arrive on Election Day. It is unlikely that any respected legal scholars hold this belief, as the Supreme Court made the Constitutionality of the issue plain in the weeks before the election. A ruling found that election officials in Pennsylvania could count absentee ballots received as late as the Friday after Election Day so long as they are postmarked by Nov. 3.
